Comment: Which is perfectly reasonable. A few years ago I called 911 because I was concerned for a neighbor after hearing particularly loud screaming and thuds from inside their apartment. Turns out the guy had hit his gf hard enough to knock her out and crack her skull.  Now, I'm a natural-born citizen. But what if I were undocumented and just trying to get through life with my head down because my family is relying on my paycheck to survive, or I was afraid of getting murdered in my country? I might second-guess myself and the woman could be dead. What if I, god forbid, end up in the same situation as my neighbor someday and *my* neighbor didn't call the cops because THEY were scared?  Local law enforcement should never be involved in matters of immigration in any way. Only local public safety. This doesn't mean they ignore crimes of immigrants; it means they ignore immigration *status* when dealing with public safety.

Comment: Lifelong central Illinoisan here. Things have only been getting better since he took office, aside from a few cities that have always been rough. I’ve been doing a ton of traveling throughout the area recently as part of my hobby, and even places that used to have a lot more urban decay are starting to look pretty decent again. Rural counties that had unbearably bad roads, including highways, not 10 years ago have all been able to repave and repair their roads. Could be a different story south of around Mt. Vernon or in northern Forgottonia since I haven’t been to those areas recently, but other than that I’m not sure what this guy is smoking saying things are worse off now than before Pritzker took office, especially outside Chicagoland.
